com.ethanzeigler.jgamegui.element

Class ImageElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ethanzeigler.jgamegui.element.AbstractElement
      • com.ethanzeigler.jgamegui.element.ImageElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ButtonImageElement, CollidableImageElement

    public class ImageElement
extends AbstractElement
    An Element that draws its image on screen from the top-right corner as the origin. Added to the window stack using JGameGUI.addElement(AbstractElement), it will be drawn to the screen on each update based on the ImageElement's current x and y origin position. The size of the image drawn is dependent on the size of the image provided.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageElement

        public ImageElement(java.lang.String resPath,
                    double xOrig,
                    double yOrig,
                    int priority)
        Initiates an image element with the given image resource path, x origin, y origin, and draw priority.
        Parameters:
        resPath - the image resource path
        xOrig - the x origin
        yOrig - the y origin
        priority - the drawing priority. The higher the priority, the later it is drawn, and over others with lower priorities

      • ImageElement

        public ImageElement(javax.swing.ImageIcon icon,
                    double xOrig,
                    double yOrig,
                    int priority)
        Initiates an image element with the given ImageIcon, x origin, y origin, and draw priority.
        Parameters:
        icon - the ImageIcon to draw
        xOrig - the x origin
        yOrig - the y origin
        priority - the drawing priority. The higher the priority, the later it is drawn, and over others with lower priorities
